Package com.concordia.soen6441riskgame

Class RGGameOLD

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.concordia.soen6441riskgame.RGGameOLD
  • public class RGGameOLD
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to store and control the information of a game. Only one game is possible during runtime
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Julian Beltran, Amit

      • RGGameOLD

    • Method Detail

      • createGraph

        void createGraph​(java.lang.StringBuilder content)
        This method is used to create two data structures: 1) Map Data Structure: This is a HashMap data structure that contains all the information related to the countries and their adjacencies with other countries. The key value is the name of a country (String), and the value of the key is an ArrayList (String) that contains all the adjacent countries. 2) Countries Data Structure: This is a HashMap data structure that contains all the information associated to the current game. The key value is the name of a country (String), and the value of the key is an ArrayList (String) that contains all the information of the county: Coordinate X in the map, coordinate Y in the map, continent, owner, and number of armies placed in a specific country.
        Parameters:
        content - Complete content of the tag [Territories] of the file.

      • createContinents

        void createContinents​(java.lang.StringBuilder content)
        This method is used to create one data structure: 1) Continents Data Structure: This is a HashMap data structure that contains all the information associated to the continents of the map. The key value is the name of a continent (String), and the value of the key is an ArrayList (String) that contains all the information of the continent: continent bonus army, and all the countries that belong to that continent.
        Parameters:
        content - Complete content of the tag [Continents].

      • assignCountries

        void assignCountries​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> players)
        This method is used to assign each country a random player, and one army by default to each country.
        Parameters:
        players - List of Players (names).

      • getNumberOfArmiesDueTerritories

        int getNumberOfArmiesDueTerritories​(int currentPlayerNumberOfCountries)
        For Reinforcement Phase: This method is used to obtain the number of armies a player has the right to place on his/her countries. This number is calculated according to the number of countries a player owns.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerNumberOfCountries - Current number of countries a player owns.
        Returns:
        Number of armies a player has the right to place on his/her countries.

      • getNumberOfArmiesDueContinents

        int getNumberOfArmiesDueContinents​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> currentPlayerCountries)
        For Reinforcement Phase: This method is used to obtain the number of armies a player has the right to place on his/her countries. This number is calculated according to the number of continents a player owns.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerCountries - List of countries a player owns.
        Returns:
        Number of armies a player has the right to place on his/her countries.

      • getCurrentPlayerAdjacentCountries

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCurrentPlayerAdjacentCountries​(java.lang.String player,
                                                                        java.lang.String country)
        Parameters:
        player - Name of the player.
        country - Name of the country.
        Returns:
        A list of all the countries that have a path in between.
